verses.verse: ( Give Thanks to the LORD, for He Is Good) הַֽלְלוּיָ֨הּ׀ <WH1984> hal·lū·yāh Hallelujah! ( Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 48) הוֹד֣וּ <WH3034> hō·w·ḏū Give thanks לַיהוָ֣ה <WH3068> Yah·weh to the LORD, כִּי־ <WH3588> kî- for ט֑וֹב <WH2896> ṭō·wḇ He is good; כִּ֖י <WH3588> kî ... לְעוֹלָ֣ם <WH5769> lə·‘ō·w·lām .... חַסְדּֽוֹ׃ <WH2617> ḥas·dōw His loving devotion endures forever

מִ֗י <WH4310> mî Who יְ֭מַלֵּל <WH4448> yə·mal·lêl can describe גְּבוּר֣וֹת <WH1369> gə·ḇū·rō·wṯ the mighty acts יְהוָ֑ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD יַ֝שְׁמִ֗יעַ <WH8085> yaš·mî·a‘ or fully proclaim כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- ... תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃ <WH8416> tə·hil·lā·ṯōw His praise?

אַ֭שְׁרֵי <WH835> ’aš·rê Blessed [are] שֹׁמְרֵ֣י <WH8104> šō·mə·rê those who uphold מִשְׁפָּ֑ט <WH4941> miš·pāṭ justice, עֹשֵׂ֖ה <WH6213> ‘ō·śêh who practice צְדָקָ֣ה <WH6666> ṣə·ḏā·qāh righteousness בְכָל־ <WH3605> ḇə·ḵāl- at all עֵֽת׃ <WH6256> ‘êṯ times.

זָכְרֵ֣נִי <WH2142> zā·ḵə·rê·nî Remember me, יְ֭הוָה <WH3068> Yah·weh O LORD, בִּרְצ֣וֹן <WH7522> bir·ṣō·wn in [Your] favor עַמֶּ֑ךָ <WH5971> ‘am·me·ḵā to Your people; פָּ֝קְדֵ֗נִי <WH6485> pā·qə·ḏê·nî visit me בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃ <WH3444> bî·šū·‘ā·ṯe·ḵā with Your salvation,

לִרְא֤וֹת׀ <WH7200> lir·’ō·wṯ that I may see בְּט֘וֹבַ֤ת <WH2896> bə·ṭō·w·ḇaṯ the prosperity בְּחִירֶ֗יךָ <WH972> bə·ḥî·re·ḵā of Your chosen ones, לִ֭שְׂמֹחַ <WH8055> liś·mō·aḥ and rejoice בְּשִׂמְחַ֣ת <WH8057> bə·śim·ḥaṯ in the gladness גּוֹיֶ֑ךָ <WH1471> gō·w·ye·ḵā of Your nation, לְ֝הִתְהַלֵּ֗ל <WH1984> lə·hiṯ·hal·lêl and give glory עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- with נַחֲלָתֶֽךָ׃ <WH5159> na·ḥă·lā·ṯe·ḵā Your inheritance.

חָטָ֥אנוּ <WH2398> ḥā·ṭā·nū We have sinned עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- like אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ <WH1> ’ă·ḇō·w·ṯê·nū our fathers; הֶעֱוִ֥ינוּ <WH5753> he·‘ĕ·wî·nū we have done wrong הִרְשָֽׁעְנוּ׃ <WH7561> hir·šā·‘ə·nū [and] acted wickedly.

אֲב֘וֹתֵ֤ינוּ <WH1> ’ă·ḇō·w·ṯê·nū Our fathers בְמִצְרַ֨יִם׀ <WH4714> ḇə·miṣ·ra·yim in Egypt לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- did not הִשְׂכִּ֬ילוּ <WH7919> hiś·kî·lū grasp נִפְלְאוֹתֶ֗יךָ <WH6381> nip̄·lə·’ō·w·ṯe·ḵā Your wonders לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō ... זָ֭כְרוּ <WH2142> zā·ḵə·rū or remember אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - רֹ֣ב <WH7230> rōḇ Your abundant חֲסָדֶ֑יךָ <WH2617> ḥă·sā·ḏe·ḵā kindness; וַיַּמְר֖וּ <WH4784> way·yam·rū but they rebelled עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- by יָ֣ם <WH3220> yām the sea, בְּיַם־ <WH3220> bə·yam- Sea. ( Or the Sea of Reeds; also in verses 9 and 22) סֽוּף׃ <WH5488> sūp̄ [there] at the Red

וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם <WH3467> way·yō·wō·šî·‘êm Yet He saved them לְמַ֣עַן <WH4616> lə·ma·‘an for the sake of שְׁמ֑וֹ <WH8034> šə·mōw His name, לְ֝הוֹדִ֗יעַ <WH3045> lə·hō·w·ḏî·a‘ known. אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - גְּבוּרָתֽוֹ׃ <WH1369> gə·ḇū·rā·ṯōw to make His power

וַיִּגְעַ֣ר <WH1605> way·yiḡ·‘ar He rebuked בְּיַם־ <WH3220> bə·yam- Sea, ס֭וּף <WH5488> sūp̄ the Red וַֽיֶּחֱרָ֑ב <WH2717> way·ye·ḥĕ·rāḇ and it dried up; וַיּוֹלִיכֵ֥ם <WH1980> way·yō·w·lî·ḵêm He led them בַּ֝תְּהֹמ֗וֹת <WH8415> bat·tə·hō·mō·wṯ through the depths כַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ <WH4057> kam·miḏ·bār as through a desert.

וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם <WH3467> way·yō·wō·šî·‘êm He saved them מִיַּ֣ד <WH3027> mî·yaḏ from the hand שׂוֹנֵ֑א <WH8130> śō·w·nê that hated them; וַ֝יִּגְאָלֵ֗ם <WH1350> way·yiḡ·’ā·lêm He redeemed them מִיַּ֥ד <WH3027> mî·yaḏ from the hand אוֹיֵֽב׃ <WH341> ’ō·w·yêḇ of the enemy.

וַיְכַסּוּ־ <WH3680> way·ḵas·sū- covered מַ֥יִם <WH4325> ma·yim The waters צָרֵיהֶ֑ם <WH6862> ṣā·rê·hem their foes; אֶחָ֥ד <WH259> ’e·ḥāḏ one מֵ֝הֶ֗ם Prep-m│Pro-3mp ( mê·hem) of them לֹ֣א 3808 Adv-NegPrt ( lō) not נוֹתָֽר׃ 3498 V-Nifal-Perf-3ms ( nō·w·ṯār) remained.
וַיַּאֲמִ֥ינוּ <WH539> way·ya·’ă·mî·nū Then they believed בִדְבָרָ֑יו <WH1697> ḇiḏ·ḇā·rāw His promises יָ֝שִׁ֗ירוּ <WH7891> yā·šî·rū [and] sang תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃ <WH8416> tə·hil·lā·ṯōw His praise.

מִֽ֭הֲרוּ <WH4116> mi·hă·rū [Yet] they soon שָׁכְח֣וּ <WH7911> šā·ḵə·ḥū forgot מַעֲשָׂ֑יו <WH4639> ma·‘ă·śāw His works לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- and failed חִ֝כּ֗וּ <WH2442> ḥik·kū to wait לַעֲצָתֽוֹ׃ <WH6098> la·‘ă·ṣā·ṯōw for His counsel.

וַיִּתְאַוּ֣וּ <WH183> way·yiṯ·’aw·wū They craved תַ֭אֲוָה <WH8378> ṯa·’ă·wāh intensely בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר <WH4057> bam·miḏ·bār in the wilderness וַיְנַסּוּ־ <WH5254> way·nas·sū- and tested אֵ֝֗ל <WH410> ’êl God בִּֽישִׁימֽוֹן׃ <WH3452> bî·šî·mō·wn in the desert.

וַיִּתֵּ֣ן <WH5414> way·yit·tên So He granted לָ֭הֶם Prep│Pro-3mp ( lā·hem) - שֶׁאֱלָתָ֑ם 7596 N-fsc│3mp ( še·’ĕ·lā·ṯām) their request, וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח 7971 Conj-w│V-Piel-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·šal·laḥ) but sent רָז֣וֹן 7332 N-ms ( rā·zō·wn) a wasting disease בְּנַפְשָֽׁם׃ 5315 Prep-b│N-fsc│3mp ( bə·nap̄·šām) upon them.

וַיְקַנְא֣וּ <WH7065> way·qan·’ū they envied לְ֭מֹשֶׁה <WH4872> lə·mō·šeh Moses, בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה <WH4264> bam·ma·ḥă·neh In the camp לְ֝אַהֲרֹ֗ן <WH175> lə·’a·hă·rōn as well as Aaron, קְד֣וֹשׁ <WH6918> qə·ḏō·wōš the holy one יְהוָֽה׃ <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD.

תִּפְתַּח־ <WH6605> tip̄·taḥ- opened up אֶ֭רֶץ <WH776> ’e·reṣ The earth וַתִּבְלַ֣ע <WH1104> wat·tiḇ·la‘ and swallowed דָּתָ֑ן <WH1885> dā·ṯān Dathan; וַ֝תְּכַ֗ס <WH3680> wat·tə·ḵas it covered עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... עֲדַ֥ת <WH5712> ‘ă·ḏaṯ the assembly אֲבִירָֽם׃ <WH48> ’ă·ḇî·rām of Abiram.

וַתִּבְעַר־ <WH1197> wat·tiḇ·‘ar- blazed אֵ֥שׁ <WH784> ’êš Then fire בַּעֲדָתָ֑ם <WH5712> ba·‘ă·ḏā·ṯām through their company; לֶ֝הָבָ֗ה <WH3852> le·hā·ḇāh flames תְּלַהֵ֥ט <WH3857> tə·la·hêṭ consumed רְשָׁעִֽים׃ <WH7563> rə·šā·‘îm the wicked.

יַעֲשׂוּ־ <WH6213> ya·‘ă·śū- they made עֵ֥גֶל <WH5695> ‘ê·ḡel a calf בְּחֹרֵ֑ב <WH2722> bə·ḥō·rêḇ At Horeb ( That is, Mount Sinai, or possibly a mountain in the range containing Mount Sinai) וַ֝יִּשְׁתַּחֲו֗וּ <WH7812> way·yiš·ta·ḥă·wū and worshiped לְמַסֵּכָֽה׃ <WH4541> lə·mas·sê·ḵāh a molten image.

וַיָּמִ֥ירוּ <WH4171> way·yā·mî·rū They exchanged אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - כְּבוֹדָ֑ם <WH3519> kə·ḇō·w·ḏām their Glory ( Or their glorious God) בְּתַבְנִ֥ית <WH8403> bə·ṯaḇ·nîṯ for the image שׁ֥וֹר <WH7794> šō·wr ox. אֹכֵ֥ל <WH398> ’ō·ḵêl of a grass-eating עֵֽשֶׂב׃ <WH6212> ‘ê·śeḇ ...

שָׁ֭כְחוּ <WH7911> ḵə·ḥū They forgot אֵ֣ל <WH410> ’êl God מוֹשִׁיעָ֑ם <WH3467> mō·wō·šî·‘ām their Savior, עֹשֶׂ֖ה <WH6213> ‘ō·śeh who did גְדֹל֣וֹת <WH1419> ḡə·ḏō·lō·wṯ great בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃ <WH4714> bə·miṣ·rā·yim things in Egypt,

נִ֭פְלָאוֹת <WH6381> nip̄·lā·’ō·wṯ wondrous works בְּאֶ֣רֶץ <WH776> bə·’e·reṣ in the land חָ֑ם <WH2526> ḥām of Ham, נ֝וֹרָא֗וֹת <WH3372> nō·w·rā·’ō·wṯ [and] awesome deeds עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- by יַם־ <WH3220> yam- Sea. סֽוּף׃ <WH5488> sūp̄ the Red

וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer So He said לְֽהַשְׁמִ֫ידָ֥ם <WH8045> lə·haš·mî·ḏām He would destroy them — לוּלֵ֡י <WH3884> lū·lê had not מֹ֘שֶׁ֤ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses בְחִיר֗וֹ <WH972> ḇə·ḥî·rōw His chosen one עָמַ֣ד <WH5975> ‘ā·maḏ stood בַּפֶּ֣רֶץ <WH6556> bap·pe·reṣ in the breach לְפָנָ֑יו <WH6440> lə·p̄ā·nāw before Him לְהָשִׁ֥יב <WH7725> lə·hā·šîḇ to divert חֲ֝מָת֗וֹ <WH2534> ḥă·mā·ṯōw His wrath מֵֽהַשְׁחִֽית׃ <WH7843> mê·haš·ḥîṯ from destroying them.

וַֽ֭יִּמְאֲסוּ <WH3988> way·yim·’ă·sū They despised בְּאֶ֣רֶץ <WH776> bə·’e·reṣ land; חֶמְדָּ֑ה <WH2532> ḥem·dāh the pleasant לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- they did not הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ <WH539> he·’ĕ·mî·nū believe לִדְבָרֽוֹ׃ <WH1697> liḏ·ḇā·rōw His promise.

וַיֵּרָגְנ֥וּ <WH7279> way·yê·rā·ḡə·nū They grumbled בְאָהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם <WH168> ḇə·’ā·ho·lê·hem in their tents לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō and did not שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ <WH8085> mə·‘ū listen בְּק֣וֹל <WH6963> bə·qō·wl to the voice יְהוָֽה׃ <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD.

וַיִּשָּׂ֣א <WH5375> way·yiś·śā So He raised יָד֣וֹ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw His hand לָהֶ֑ם Prep-l│Pro-3mp ( lā·hem) and swore לְהַפִּ֥יל 5307 Prep-l│V-Hifil-Inf ( lə·hap·pîl) to cast them down א֝וֹתָ֗ם 853 DirObjM│3mp ( ’ō·w·ṯām) - בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ 4057 Prep-b, Art│N-ms ( bam·miḏ·bār) in the wilderness,

וּלְהַפִּ֣יל <WH5307> ū·lə·hap·pîl to disperse ( Or cast down or cause to fall) זַ֭רְעָם <WH2233> zar·‘ām their offspring בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם <WH1471> bag·gō·w·yim among the nations וּ֝לְזָרוֹתָ֗ם <WH2219> ū·lə·zā·rō·w·ṯām and scatter them בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃ <WH776> bā·’ă·rā·ṣō·wṯ throughout the lands.

וַ֭יִּצָּ֣מְדוּ <WH6775> way·yiṣ·ṣā·mə·ḏū They yoked themselves לְבַ֣עַל <WH1187> lə·ḇa·‘al to פְּע֑וֹר <WH1187> pə·‘ō·wr Baal of Peor וַ֝יֹּאכְל֗וּ <WH398> way·yō·ḵə·lū and ate זִבְחֵ֥י <WH2077> ziḇ·ḥê sacrifices מֵתִֽים׃ <WH4191> mê·ṯîm offered to lifeless gods.

וַ֭יַּכְעִיסוּ <WH3707> way·yaḵ·‘î·sū So they provoked [the LORD] to anger בְּמַֽעַלְלֵיהֶ֑ם <WH4611> bə·ma·‘al·lê·hem with their deeds, וַתִּפְרָץ־ <WH6555> wat·tip̄·rāṣ- broke out בָּ֝֗ם Prep│3mp ( bām) among them. מַגֵּפָֽה׃ 4046 N-fs ( mag·gê·p̄āh) and a plague

וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד <WH5975> way·ya·‘ă·mōḏ stood פִּֽ֭ינְחָס <WH6372> pî·nə·ḥās But Phinehas וַיְפַלֵּ֑ל <WH6419> way·p̄al·lêl and intervened, וַ֝תֵּעָצַ֗ר <WH6113> wat·tê·‘ā·ṣar was restrained. הַמַּגֵּפָֽה׃ <WH4046> ham·mag·gê·p̄āh and the plague

וַתֵּחָ֣שֶׁב <WH2803> wat·tê·ḥā·šeḇ It was credited ל֭וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) to him לִצְדָקָ֑ה 6666 Prep-l│N-fs ( liṣ·ḏā·qāh) as righteousness לְדֹ֥ר 1755 Prep-l│N-ms ( lə·ḏōr) for endless וָ֝דֹ֗ר 1755 Conj-w│N-ms ( wā·ḏōr) generations עַד־ 5704 Prep ( ‘aḏ-) to come. עוֹלָֽם׃ 5769 N-ms ( ‘ō·w·lām) ...

וַ֭יַּקְצִיפוּ <WH7107> way·yaq·ṣî·p̄ū they angered עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- the LORD, מֵ֥י <WH4325> mê At the waters מְרִיבָ֑ה <WH4809> mə·rî·ḇāh of Meribah ( Meribah means quarreling; see .) וַיֵּ֥רַע <WH7489> way·yê·ra‘ and trouble came לְ֝מֹשֶׁ֗ה <WH4872> lə·mō·šeh to Moses בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃ <WH5668> ba·‘ă·ḇū·rām because of them.

כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- For הִמְר֥וּ <WH4784> him·rū they rebelled against אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - רוּח֑וֹ <WH7307> rū·ḥōw His Spirit, ( Or they provoked His Spirit) וַ֝יְבַטֵּ֗א <WH981> way·ḇaṭ·ṭê and [Moses] spoke rashly בִּשְׂפָתָֽיו׃ <WH8193> biś·p̄ā·ṯāw with his lips.
